text: Just got enrolled for Stony University data analytics bootcamp. However, being a BI Analyst fits my skill set more. Great explanation btw!

author: @IbrahimShahKhan
text: At Amazon, the roles are reversed. BAs are more technical and get paid more.

author: @lukalamarche748
text: I'm a business analyst und I do absoluetly not programming in sql or else. And rarely excel, i wish I did what you described :'( , is it not more business intelligence analyst?

author: @countdowntorevolution9986
text: In the UK Data Analyst has basically evolved to mean "basic office administrator", which is causing all sorts of confusion on the job market.    Took me a while to work out that the "Data Analyst" jobs I was being put forward for were really just clerical roles that called for no coding or even formula skills.  And Business Analyst can often mean someone who looks at the bigger picture - how systems of procedures all work together (although again sometimes denotes a quite basic operational admin role)
